title: [K-12] Short-Intensive Professional Development Course for Elementary Math Teachers Based on Lesson Study: Enhancing Problem-Solving and Proof Competencies (Integrating Mathematical Inquiry, Analysis, and Proof)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics pedagogy knowledge, online instruction experience, understanding of elementary mathematics curriculum (calculation, geometry, measurement, patterns, data analysis), and basic statistical/graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative project-based assessments using personal devices, emphasizing visual modeling and data analysis activities with mathematical manipulatives/software. Aims to develop competencies in graph interpretation, statistical evidence-based lesson design.

learning_goals: Teachers clearly define learning objectives during lesson design and strengthen curriculum alignment by analyzing mathematical formulas, equations, and problem types.

Teachers design and implement lessons that promote studentsâ€™ logical thinking and problem-solving skills using discovery learning-based questioning strategies and equation/graph analysis techniques.
Teachers enhance collaborative competencies by deriving lesson improvement plans based on peer feedback and analyze instructional effectiveness using statistical data and probability analysis.

Learners systematically document the lesson improvement process through project deliverables and can create presentation materials including mathematical proofs, calculation processes, and graph interpretations.

resources: Zoom account and real-time collaboration tools

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
